brewery.brewery_description:
Stanislav Bernard, Josef Vávra and Rudolf Šmejkal won at auction the privatisation of the bankrupt brewery in Humpolec. 

Initially established in the 16th century and now under its current owners since 1991, It did not take long for the Family brewery in Humpolec alongside Bernard beer to become a well-known premium brand throughout the entire Czech Republic.

To distinguish their beer from other beers on the Czech market, they chose to make honest traditional unpasteurised beer, brewed with craftsmen like skill from the best ingredients. 

Thanks to its traditional procedures, Bernard beer stands out for its harmony of fullness and bitterness.

The brewery continues to grow, not only due to the success of its beers, but also establishing an iconic brand, which you will be able to become familiar with not only throughout the Czech Republic, but also in many countries worldwide.

Here at the brewery, we honour traditional manufacturing procedures and so in our cellars, the fermentation of beer is carried out in fermentation rooms and beer then matures in lager cellars. Slowly, as the traditional technology of  making  beer  requires,  it  awaits  its customers   for   several   weeks   at   a temperature  of  1-2°C.

beer.beer_description: The Celebration lager with a fine yeast culture is an unpasteurized beer with distinctive flavor, fine yeast taste and aroma. There can be a yeasty sediment on the bottom of the bottle, and the beer can be slightly cloudy during the consumation.

items.badge_description: Traveling the world is hard, but not for you. It's as easy as cracking open a new brew! You have had a beer from at least 5 different regions around the world. Try 5 more for Level 2!

beer.beer_description: Czechs are the world masters in drinking beer. The average Czech drinks almost 150 litres of it per year. Up  to  90%  of  men  and  more  than  half  of  women  drink  it  regularly.  And  certainly  only  a  very  small number of adults have never tasted the national drink. An overwhelming majority of Czechs drink lager, which has only been brewed in our land for about 200 years. The world of beer is, however, much richer.Before  the  start  of  brewing  bottom-fermented  beers  in  the  Czech  lands,  top-fermented  wheat  beers prevailed. With the advent of lagers this beer style became a distant memory, even though in Germany, Austria, Belgium, Ireland and England they have remained a common part of daily life. And now it is making a return to the Czech Republic.Spice up your day with BERNARD BOHEMIAN ALE. This beer is bottle-conditioned, thanks to yeast being  added  during  the  bottling  process.  It  contains  8.2%  alcohol  with  a  lively  fruity  aroma,  a  clean malty taste with a dash of spicy coriander and a gentle warmth in the finish.With  this  unique  beer  on  the  Czech  market  you  can  look  forward  to  a  glorious  experience,  greatly exceeding what you have become used to!

items.badge_description: Looking for more kick than a session beer, but want to be able to stay for a few rounds? You have to keep it in the middle. That's 160 beers with an ABV greater than 5% and less than 10%. Try 5 more for Level 33!

It will captivate you with traditional flavors, which is characterized by its delicate richness, balanced bitterness and delicate hop aroma and a thick and rich foam.

beer.beer_description: The amber lager with a fine yeast culture is a pungent semi-dark lager. This genuine blend bring you a new  experience  that  combines  the  drink-ability  of  pale  lager and  interesting  aromas  and  flavours  of special malts used for brewing dark lager. Amber lager is a unpasteurised beer with its bitterness in harmony with a fine caramel aroma and tasty fullness

items.badge_description: There's beer in them thar hills! You're setting off on your journey through the world of beer, but be sure to take a little time to get to know each brewery as you go. That's a beer from 80 different breweries. Try 5 more for Level 17!
99 bottles of beer on the wall, 99 bottles of beer. Take one down, pass it around.... That's 40 checkins with the serving style of Bottle. Try 5 more for Level 9!

beer.beer_description: The Celebration lager with a fine yeast culture is an unpasteurized beer with distinctive flavor, fine yeast taste and aroma. There can be a yeasty sediment on the bottom of the bottle, and the beer can be slightly cloudy during the consumation.

The strong character of Bernard Bohemian Ale started our way of top fermented beers two years ago and it is still very successful. It was only a matter of time when we come up with something new and unique. Here you go BERNARD IPA. Again we decided to brew IPA our own way using only Czech hops SAAZ, SLADEK and KAZBEK. Hoppy aroma reminds grapefruit and orange peel. 5.6% abv, medium body, dry character and intensive bitter finish –the right combination of friends you can sit with the whole night long.

This  unpasteurised  dark  lager  is  all  about  speciality  malts. The  combination  of caramel, Bavarian,Pilsner,  and  colour  malts results  in  its  roasted  character,which is  an  amazing  alternative  to  the  sharp grassiness of good Bohemian  pilsners. After the first sip,you will be  pleased by coffee, caramel and nutty flavors balanced with the bitterness of noble Saaz hops. The unique experience of this traditional lager is under scored by the EU protected geographical indication“Czech Beer”and several Czech and international degustation awards. Dip your nose into its brown head and enjoy the taste of this deep dark lager.

items.badge_description: It's the final week! Week 4 wraps with the last 3 styles of this year's Year in Beer Style Hunt. You've just tried one of three available styles during the week.

Known for their pale lagers and pilsners, the Czech Republic has a long standing tradition of brewing. With the highest beer consumption per capita in the world, you’ll fit right in. That's 50 different beers from a brewery from the Czech Republic. Try 5 more for Level 11!

beer.beer_description: The strong character of Bernard Bohemian Ale started our way of top fermented beers two years ago and it is still very successful. It was only a matter of time when we come up with something new and unique. Here you go BERNARD IPA. Again we decided to brew IPA our own way using only Czech hops SAAZ, SLADEK and KAZBEK. Hoppy aroma reminds grapefruit and orange peel. 5.6% abv, medium body, dry character and intensive bitter finish –the right combination of friends you can sit with the whole night long.

items.badge_description: Does the word picking favorites mean anything to you? Obviously not. That's 10 different beers in a row.

Want to enjoy a day of brews, but need to keep your wits sharp? There are plenty of delicious brews under 5% for you to sip on throughout the day. That's 5 different beers with an ABV of 5% and lower. Try 5 more for Level 2!

There's beer in them thar hills! You're setting off on your journey through the world of beer, but be sure to take a little time to get to know each brewery as you go. That's a beer from 10 different breweries. Try 5 more for Level 3!

items.badge_description: Thanks for staying at home, and checking in with Untappd! It allows us to stay connected to a community of beer lovers, just like you, even if we can't be in the same physical location. From our home to yours, cheers and stay safe!
99 bottles of beer on the wall, 99 bottles of beer. Take one down, pass it around.... That's 10 checkins with the serving style of Bottle. Try 5 more for Level 3!

beer.beer_description: The Celebration lager with a fine yeast culture is an unpasteurized beer with distinctive flavor, fine yeast taste and aroma. There can be a yeasty sediment on the bottom of the bottle, and the beer can be slightly cloudy during the consumation.

The amber lager with a fine yeast culture is a pungent semi-dark lager. This genuine blend bring you a new  experience  that  combines  the  drink-ability  of  pale  lager and  interesting  aromas  and  flavours  of special malts used for brewing dark lager. Amber lager is a unpasteurised beer with its bitterness in harmony with a fine caramel aroma and tasty fullness

This  unpasteurised  dark  lager  is  all  about  speciality  malts. The  combination  of caramel, Bavarian,Pilsner,  and  colour  malts results  in  its  roasted  character,which is  an  amazing  alternative  to  the  sharp grassiness of good Bohemian  pilsners. After the first sip,you will be  pleased by coffee, caramel and nutty flavors balanced with the bitterness of noble Saaz hops. The unique experience of this traditional lager is under scored by the EU protected geographical indication“Czech Beer”and several Czech and international degustation awards. Dip your nose into its brown head and enjoy the taste of this deep dark lager.

We  brew this  outstanding  lager  with  water  from  our  own  wells  located in the  Bohemian-Moravian Highlands. Barley germinates on the malting floors of the Bernard malt house as it was done centuries ago. The traditional Czech double decoction mashing technique brings you a full body taste in harmony with the refreshing bitterness provided by noble Saaz hops. To keep the best sensorial conditions, we made the decision not pasteurise the lager after it spends several weeks maturing in the lager cellars.This way we can provide you the experience of completely natural Bohemian style lager at its best.

Bernard Premium Bohemian Lager is a light, golden-yellow bohemian-pilsner-style for all seasons.  

This unpasteurized light lager is a beer with a balanced bitter taste in harmony with its tasty fullness, hop aroma and rich foam.

The scent is large and balanced with clear maltiness and nice hop room.  The taste is medium-bodied, fresh and aromatic with a long aftertaste and mild hop.

Czechs are the world masters in drinking beer. The average Czech drinks almost 150 litres of it per year. Up  to  90%  of  men  and  more  than  half  of  women  drink  it  regularly.  And  certainly  only  a  very  small number of adults have never tasted the national drink. An overwhelming majority of Czechs drink lager, which has only been brewed in our land for about 200 years. The world of beer is, however, much richer.Before  the  start  of  brewing  bottom-fermented  beers  in  the  Czech  lands,  top-fermented  wheat  beers prevailed. With the advent of lagers this beer style became a distant memory, even though in Germany, Austria, Belgium, Ireland and England they have remained a common part of daily life. And now it is making a return to the Czech Republic.Spice up your day with BERNARD BOHEMIAN ALE. This beer is bottle-conditioned, thanks to yeast being  added  during  the  bottling  process.  It  contains  8.2%  alcohol  with  a  lively  fruity  aroma,  a  clean malty taste with a dash of spicy coriander and a gentle warmth in the finish.With  this  unique  beer  on  the  Czech  market  you  can  look  forward  to  a  glorious  experience,  greatly exceeding what you have become used to!

Award-winning winter special from the craft brewery in Czech Humpolec. An English winter warmer in Bohemian vintage, seasoned with coriander The Czech master brewery does not only master lager beer!

Fragrance and taste
Healthy and fruity with pure, malty tones, hints of coriander and a slightly warming round.

serving tip
Advantageously served fridge-cooled. Ideal for both Czech and Swedish home cooking.

The strong character of Bernard Bohemian Ale started our way of top fermented beers two years ago and it is still very successful. It was only a matter of time when we come up with something new and unique. Here you go BERNARD IPA. Again we decided to brew IPA our own way using only Czech hops SAAZ, SLADEK and KAZBEK. Hoppy aroma reminds grapefruit and orange peel. 5.6% abv, medium body, dry character and intensive bitter finish –the right combination of friends you can sit with the whole night long.

A golden Pilsner-style lager, characterized by its richness of colour and aromatic bouquet. Bernard Beer provides a full bodied flavor – smooth and refreshing with no aftertaste – a well balanced brew. The beer is brewed in compliance to the Bavarian Purity Law of 1516, using only Czech two-row barley malt, noble SAAZ hops,soft water from private wells and Bernard’s signature yeast strain

Ingredients: water, barley malt from the Bernard malt house, prepared Saaz hops, hop extract

Average nutritional values in 100 ml:
Energy content 155 kJ/37 kcal, fats 0 g, saturated fat 0 g, carbohydrates 3,7 g, sugars 0,5 g, protein 0,5 g, salt 0 g

beer.beer_name: Bohemian Lager with fine yeast (Kvasnicový ležák 11)
beer.beer_description:
Light lager Bernard with fine yeast brings you delicate hop fragrance, full and delicious yeast taste and refreshing high bite. You can enjoy it at any occasion at home or with friends. There can be a yeasty sediment so that the beer can be slightly cloudy the consumation.

Kvasnicový ležák 11 s jemnou chmelovou vůní, plnou a lahodnou kvasnicovou chutí a osvěžujícím vysokým řízem si vychutnáte při jakékoli příležitosti, doma i s přáteli. Díky obsahu jemné kultury pivovarských kvasinek může pivo obsahovat sedlinku a být tak při konzumaci lehce zakalené.

This is the best version of lager you can have. Very fresh, natural, unfiltered and unpasteurised. The kegs are filled straight from the lager tank so you an enjoy the exceptional full body character underlined with a yeasty aroma and taste.

Gluten-free lager is intended for celiaks or person suffering from celiac disease or gluten-free diet due to the gluten content of up to 20 mg/kg. It will captivate you with traditional flavors, which is characterized by its delicate richness, balanced bitterness and delicate hop aroma and a thick and rich foam.

A non-alcoholic light beer produced using the traditional brewing procedure without pasteurization, preserving its original beer taste, colour and brewing aroma. The beer is pleasantly bitter with rich foam.

Bernard ́s Black Avalanche brings pleasure and a remarkable experience for all your senses. This dark lager infused with nitrogen is characterised by avalanche effect -slow whirling of dense creamy foam that occurs after pouring the beer into glass. It combines an irresistible look with smooth taste of dark slightly bitter beer

Creamy filling mouthfeel with medium body. Taste is moderate sweet with dark caramel and stouty notes of chocolate and coffee. Dry bitter finish in the aftertaste

A refreshing non-alcoholic plum beverage is produced using the original brewing procedure from the first-class ingredients and natural plum sauce and aroma. 

Ingredients: non-alcoholic semi-dark beer (water, barely malts , prepared Saaz hops, hop extract), 35% plum juice, plum aroma, steviol glycoside (sweetener), E202 (preservative).

beer.beer_name: Light beer with fine yeast (Kvasnicové pivo 10)
beer.beer_description:
Light beer Bernard with fine yeast brings you full and delicious yeast taste. This beer is characterized by pleasant bitterness, distinct pungency, with fine hop aroma and rich foam. There can be a yeasty sediment so that the beer can be slightly cloudy the consumation.

Kvasnicová desítka Bernard Vám přináší plnou a lahodnou kvasnicovou chuť. Charakterizuje ji příjemná hořkost a výrazný říz s jemnou chmelovou vůní a bohatou pěnou. Může obsahovat kvasnicovou sedlinu a být tak při konzumaci lehce zakalena.

A refreshing non-alcoholic sour cherry beverage is produced using the original brewing procedure from the first-class ingredients and natural sour cherry sauce and aroma. 

Ingredients: non-alcoholic pale beer (water, barley malt, prepared Saaz hops, hop extract), 35% sour cherry juice, sour cherry aroma, steviol glycoside (sweetener), E202 (preservative), E211.

This non-alcoholic semi-dark beer is produced using the original brewing procedure without pasteurization and has an amber colour and combines the harmony of a sweet caramel aroma with a pleasant bitter taste.

This is the best version of lager you can have. Very fresh, natural, unfiltered and unpasteurised. The kegs are filled straight from the lager tank so you an enjoy the exceptional full body character underlined with a yeasty aroma and taste.
A pungent lager is an unpasteurized beer with its bitterness in harmony with a fine caramel aroma and tasty fullness.
Naše nové nefiltrované nealkoholické pivo se skutečnou přírodní grepovou šťávou je lahodně hořké, krásně voní a fantasticky osvěží.

This is the best version of lager you can have. Very fresh, natural, unfiltered and unpasteurised. The kegs are filled straight from the lager tank so you an enjoy the exceptional full body character underlined with a yeasty aroma and taste.

This is the best version of lager you can have. Very fresh, natural, unfiltered and unpasteurised. The kegs are filled straight from the lager tank so you an enjoy the exceptional full body character underlined with a yeasty aroma and taste.
A traditional unpasteurized czech beer.

IPL je typické spodně kvašené pivo, ale k nachmelení se používají aromatické chmele určené pro svrchně kvašené pivo typu IPA, jako jsou Agnus, Amarillo a Citra. Ve vůni i chuti jsou cítit citrusy, charakteristická je ovšem silnější, lahodně doznívající hořkost. V případě našeho IPL Bernard je to 60 jednotek hořkosti, běžný ležák má kolem 35 jednotek.

Rodinný pivovar Bernard navařil nového speciálu limitované množství 220 hektolitrů. Jen necelá desetina z navařeného množství je na čepu, a to přímo v pivovaru v Návštěvnickém centru Bernard v Humpolci. V lahvích s patentním uzávěrem je Bernard IPL k dostání ve značkových prodejnách pivovaru.
